author: Darryn Albert
title: 4-time NFL Pro Bowler removed from flight for 'unruly behavior'
text:
A former NFL Pro Bowler apparently caused some trouble up in the skies this week.
Ex-Minnesota Vikings defensive end Everson Griffen was removed from a flight on Wednesday for allegedly causing a disturbance, TMZ Sports reported. The flight was a Delta Airlines plane traveling from Chicago to Minneapolis.
Griffen is accused of creating a scene just minutes after the flight took off from O’Hare International Airport. As a result, the plane had to return to O’Hare in order for Griffen to be removed.
TMZ notes that it is unclear if Griffen was arrested over the incident. However, a Delta spokesperson said in a statement that Griffen had been exhibiting “unruly behavior.”
“Delta has zero tolerance for unruly behavior and will always work with law enforcement to that end,” the spokesperson told TMZ. “We apologize to our customers for the delay in their travel as safety and security comes before everything else at Delta.”
Griffen, now 37 years old, played in the NFL from 2010-21. He was a four-time Pro Bowler as well as a one-time All-Pro selection (all with the Minnesota Vikings). Griffen later played for the Dallas Cowboys and the Detroit Lions before ultimately ending his career with 85.5 sacks (101st on the NFL’s all-time list) and 403 combined tackles over 170 total games played.
During the latter part of his NFL career, Griffen was involved in a troubling incident with law enforcement at his Minnesota home. In the wake of that incident, Griffen revealed that he had been diagnosed with bipolar disorder.

author: Morteza Ahmadi Al Hashem
title: Iran defense min. urges Muslim states to cut ties with Israel
text:
TEHRAN, Sep. 26 (MNA) – Iran's Defense Minister Brigadier General Aziz Nasirzadeh urges the governments of Muslim countries to cut off diplomatic relations with Israel, expel its ambassadors and impose sanctions on the criminal Zionist regime.
“Muslim states should not merely suffice to denunciation of Israeli crimes. They are rather required to put pressure on the regime to stop its genocide and prepare the ground for its collapse by severing political relations with the regime, expelling its ambassadors and ending mutual economic relations,” he said.
Nasirzadeh also underlined the need for Muslim countries and freedom-loving nations of the world to implement deterrent measures against the brutalities of the Zionist regime.
“Zionist usurpers are gravely mistaken to think that acts of terror can destroy the resistance front, as the spirit of resistance has defeated the Zionist regime. The idea of ​​jihad and resistance will never be obliterated through bombs and mass killings,” he said.
Iran's defense minister made the remarks on Thursday as he visited many wounded victims of the recent Israeli terrorist attack in Lebanon, who have been transferred to Iranian hospitals for medical treatment.
Nasirzadeh said the idea of resistance and steadfastness against oppressors derives from Islamic teachings and has its roots in the Holy Qur'an.
“According to the divine promise in the Holy Qur'an, we must resist oppression and oppressors, including Zionists. This movement will continue until complete destruction of the regime,” he said.
The Iranian defense minister said anti-human acts are expected to be committed only by the Zionist regime with the support of the United States and Europe.
“One is bewildered how the world order that the West is propagating has resulted in genocide and damage to civilians,” he said.
Nasirzadeh touched upon Israel's use of communication devices (pagers) for terrorist attacks.
“Such behaviors disrupt commercial relationships among countries; because commercial firms and manufacturers of communication devices are fundamentally required to produce these devices in such a way that their use would pose no risk to consumers, and not to turn these devices into bombs and tools of terror.”
MA/Press TV

author: Daily Times Leader
title: Affordable Pet Cremation of Florida Opens to Serve Pet Owners and Veterinarians with Compassionate End-of-Life Services | User | dailytimesleader.com
text:
Jacksonville, FL - April 23, 2025 - Affordable Pet Cremation of Florida (APC-FL) is now serving pet owners and veterinary clinics across North and Central Florida. Founded by a longtime animal advocate, APC-FL provides timely, respectful, and affordable cremation services for families facing the loss of a beloved companion.
“Losing a pet is never easy, and our goal is to make that journey a little gentler for families,” said Robert Altomare, the Founder of Affordable Pet Cremation of Florida. “Pets are family, and they deserve to be remembered with care and dignity. We’re here to support owners through that process with compassion, clarity, and respect.”
APC-FL offers three cremation options: private, semi-private, and communal. All cremation packages include a temporary plastic urn, a certificate of cremation, and a remembrance pin with optional upgrades featuring personalized keepsakes or cremation jewelry. They also offer clay paw prints as memorials.
In addition to working directly with individual pet owners, APC-FL partners with local veterinary clinics to provide bulk wholesale pricing, white-labeled cremation services, and free pick-up from veterinary offices. Home pick-up services are also available in select areas.
Before launching APC-FL, Altomare was actively involved in pet rescue and animal welfare efforts, including flying adopted animals to their new homes as part of the Pilots N Paws charity network. His personal commitment to animal well-being continues to shape the company’s values and service-first approach.
The opening of APC-FL marks a meaningful step for the North Florida community, giving pet owners and veterinarians access to a reliable partner during one of life’s most difficult moments. By offering affordable and respectful aftercare, APC-FL helps families navigate loss with dignity while supporting clinics in providing seamless, end-of-life services. Its presence also strengthens the local pet care ecosystem and highlights the importance of honoring the human-animal bond with care and compassion.
“We built APC-FL with both families and veterinary practices in mind,” added Altomare. “Our launch reflects a commitment to making high-quality, compassionate aftercare more accessible across North and Central Florida.”
To learn more about Affordable Pet Cremation of Florida and to explore its cremation options, please visit http://www.affordablepetcremationfl.com or call (904) 955-8521.

author: PODER360
title: Queiroga comemora “liderança” no 2º lugar em pesquisa de João Pessoa
text:
O ex-ministro da Saúde e pré-candidato Marcelo Queiroga (PL) comemorou, em publicação em conjunto com o diretório de João Pessoa (PB) do PL, a “liderança” no 2º lugar em pesquisa eleitoral para a prefeitura da capital paraibana.
No levantamento, Queiroga aparece com 19,5% das intenções de voto. Está atrás do atual prefeito, Cícero Lucena (PP), com 27,9% dos votos.
Formulário de cadastro receba alertas grátis do Poder360 quero receber por e-mail concordo com os termos da LGPD . quero receber no WhatsApp Inscreva-se quero receber no Telegram Inscreva-se “Marcelo Queiroga lidera 2º lugar nas pesquisas” , diz a postagem compartilhada na 4ª feira (10.jul.2024).
Veja abaixo:
Outro post, publicado pelo ex-ministro em 6 de julho, declara que Queiroga “dispara e está no 2º turno para prefeito” .
No entanto, o ex-ministro aparece tecnicamente empatado com o 3º candidato, o ex-prefeito Luciano Cartaxo (PT), que tem 14,8% das intenções de voto, em um 1º cenário estimulado (quando os nomes dos candidatos são apresentados) de 1º turno, com outros 5 candidatos.
A pesquisa citada pelo paraibano foi realizada pelo Instituto Veritá de 10 a 14 de junho e ouviu 1.202 entrevistados. A margem de erro é de 3,5 pontos percentuais e o intervalo de confiança, de 95%. Está registrada no TSE (Tribunal Superior Eleitoral) sob o nº PB-07225/2024 .
Segundo a empresa que fez o levantamento, o custo do estudo foi de R$ 39.779,40. O valor foi pago com recursos próprios.
